thread.title: RomPEllis published Dartmoor under 'as great a threat as ever', says preservation...

author: RomPEllis
title: RomPEllis published Dartmoor under 'as great a threat as ever', says preservation...
text:
Dartmoor under 'as great a threat as ever', says preservation chief By RomPEllis | Posted: June 07, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES There are increasing tensions in Dartmoor National Park according to Phil Hutt Dartmoor under 'as great a threat as ever', says preservation chief X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 
The boss of the charity that protects the future of Dartmoor has warned that it is under 'as great a threat as ever'. 
Phil Hutt, chief executive of Dartmoor Preservation Association, was speaking at the association's annual general meeting. 
Mr Hutt highlighted the increasing tensions in the national park between conflicting types of recreational use, housing development and the need to preserve landscapes, market housing for the better off against affordable homes for young local people and the demand for a business infrastructure against the need to maintain the park's tranquillity. 
Read more: Motorcyclist killed in crash with a cow on quiet North Devon lane 
"The DPA will help to steer a course between these conflicting demands, keeping ever in sight our goal of protecting those features that make Dartmoor special - its wilderness and peace," he told the meeting in Bridestowe on Saturday, June 3. 
"On top of these threats, in the light of Britain's exit from the European Union, there will also be tremendous uncertainty over the maintenance of environmental protection measures, and the future of upland farming which is so crucial to the management of our landscapes. 
"It is essential that any deal for Brexit recognises the role of hill farmers in maintaining Dartmoor's unique landscape, and the value of Dartmoor for the population as a whole, as a place where we can enjoy freedom and fresh air in splendid surroundings. 
"The Dartmoor Preservation Association, with its solid support from volunteers and members, will champion Dartmoor's special qualities which are of fundamental importance to us all," he added.
